perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'several' and replaced by 'one' in the qualification requirements could introduce legal risk. Securities laws often require offerings to be qualified in multiple jurisdictions to protect investors. Limiting the qualification to 'one jurisdiction as chosen by the company' could lead to non-compliance with state and federal securities laws, potentially resulting in legal challenges and liabilities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State and Federal Securities Laws (e.g., Securities Act of 1933, state Blue Sky laws)

perturbation.original_text: The Company will pay the expenses of printing and distributing to the Remarketing Agent all such documents.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company may pay some expenses of printing and distributing to the Remarketing Agent such documents.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'will' to 'may' introduces uncertainty regarding the company's obligation to cover these essential remarketing expenses. This is a material change that could impact the Remarketing Agent's willingness to participate, and some may consider this a form of economic duress, especially if these costs are significant. This can lead to legal complications regarding breach of contract or failure to execute remarketing duties due to a lack of resources.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law and implied duty of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: (i) The representations, warranties and agreements of the Company and the Trust in Section 1 are true and correct in all material respects as of the Remarketing Settlement Date; the Company and the Trust have complied with in all material respects with all of their agreements contained herein to be performed prior to or on the Remarketing Settlement Date; and the conditions set forth in Sections 6(k) have been fulfilled.
perturbation.changed_text: (i) The representations, warranties and agreements of the Company and the Trust in Section 1 are true and correct as of the Remarketing Settlement Date; the Company and the Trust have complied with all of their agreements contained herein to be performed prior to or on the Remarketing Settlement Date; and the conditions set forth in Sections 6(k) have been fulfilled.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase 'in all material respects' from the certification requirement regarding the accuracy of representations, warranties, and agreements introduces a higher standard of absolute accuracy. While seemingly innocuous, this shift places an unreasonable burden on the company to ensure every single aspect of the representations is perfectly accurate, regardless of materiality. Any minor, immaterial inaccuracy could be argued as a breach of this certification, leading to legal challenges.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law and interpretation of materiality in legal contracts
